What is Microsoft .NET?
The definition of Microsoft .NET has evolved and not
everyone has a current understanding of exactly what
it means. Microsoft defines .NET as a set of Microsoft
software technologies for connecting our world
of information, people, systems and devices.
1 This is
the implementation of Microsoft's strategy to address
network computing and integration using XML Web
services technology.
The Components of .NET
Essentially, Microsoft .NET is the basic organizing
principle for all its solutions. The basic elements of .NET
are shown in Figure 1.
XML Web Services
The heart of Microsoft .NET is XML Web services. The
ubiquity of Internet connectivity means people and
computers can communicate inexpensively from any-
where. XML enables a universal, standards-based
exchange of data across operating systems and
platforms. XML Web services combine the XML data
standards with Internet communications protocols to
revolutionize how applications talk to each other.
XML Web services technology provides the capability
to create standard interfaces to discrete business
processes, and to easily re-use the resulting compo-
nents to support a dynamic business environment.
